website_summaries.verdict: Inflatable yet performs like a boat made of composite material.
pros: Works without a motor but can be configured to run with an electric motor as well
About the size of a sedan
Customers feel safe and note the raft's high performance
cons: A few reports of valve leakage
If this does occur, contact customer service right away

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome raft! Very sturdy. I like having the ability to oar not just paddle. Not a cheap floaty toy, took it down the river and hit more rocks than I would like to admit and it held up great.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Really nice raft!
customer_reviews.text: On the strength of other small boat cruisers, I ordered this raft as a tender for an upcoming trip. My expectations were low...... Got it today and inflated it. Holy WOW! It’s a LOT heavier duty than I expected, especially for the price! I’ll get back with a review after my trip......but this is MUCH more raft than I expected! The floor is the heaviest part. It may be dispensed with in the name of storage space. All put together, though, with the keel inflated, it honestly looks like it could easily take a 2hp motor! I may just buy that mount and give it a shot!
customer_reviews.author: Ilance

customer_reviews.title: Good, stable, plenty of room
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Took two of our grandchildren ages 12 and 9 along with Papaw and me and had a very good time cruising the lake at the campsite. Plenty of room for all 4 to fish. The kids felt secure due to the reinforced bottom that gave overall stability to the boat. We plan to put a transom and motor on next year, but for now, we will row-row-row! One note, be sure to follow the directions for inflation as the seats, bottom beam and all have to go in order.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Llewellyn

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good construction for a reasonable price. Ran the south fork of the Flathead River from Glacier National Park down to Columbia Falls without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Bob K

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boat - bad paddles
customer_reviews.text: So very pleased with this boat. It is sturdy and I took my 2 dogs and myself in the lakes of Tn on my vacation. The only negative I have to sa about it are the paddles. They came apart a few times and I had to paddle (instead of row) to fetch them in the lake. So, as far as row boat... good luck.. as a paddle with one paddle right to left it worked very well. I will be buying the trolling motor for it when I return from my vacation because Amazon wont deliver to my campsite lol
customer_reviews.author: Has No Game

customer_reviews.title: Just awesome. Bravo, Intex.
customer_reviews.text: Exceptional boat for the price. Intex delivers again. I’m rarely if ever disappointed with their products, but this one outshines most others. Though this boat doesn’t have an internal bladder and doesn’t self-bail, it’s otherwise easy to confuse this boat with high end inflatable whitewater and motor boats. The material is super burly and it inflates to a perfect, unwrinkled, solid form. Functionally, the floor is perfect but extremely heavy (comparable to the weight of the boat). If the battens were made of a lighter plastic or carbon fiber it’d be hard to find a flaw with the entire rig. Flies around for hours with agility with a Minnkota motor and accompanying battery. Buy it. Or the bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory R.

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: We had a up coming trip to ride the Guadalupe river in New Braunsfield Texas. Raft rental would of cost me $160 a day so we purchased this raft and, after hitting as many sharp rocks as we did, the boat held up awesome . After reading the past reviews I had decided to air it up the night before to make sure the "Boston valves" did not leak. Well one of them did. So I wiped a little dish soap on the O-ring and pumped it up and BAM no leak we used this boat 3 days in a row with no problems. I would happily recommend this boat.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: I see us using this more often than our 12ft aluminum boat
customer_reviews.text: Great quality raft. In fact I see us using this more often than our 12ft aluminum boat. 2 people is comfortable with room to spare. 3 is the limit. Very sturdy floor - I'm 200+ lbs and can stand up just fine with no fear of tipping or caving in. Pretty awesome. Add the trolling motor bracket and you've got a fishing machine. Even with a heavy deep cycle battery, trolling motor and me in the back of it there is no feeling of losing freeboard or being tipsy. I think we'll be using this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Berg

customer_reviews.title: Up until the seam gave way it was an awesome
customer_reviews.text: We haven't even had this boat for 2 months and the seam along the middle on the bottom has a hole in it. We have sealed it sooooo much and it still does not hold. It's apparently a manufacturer defect. Amazon says we are out of the return window which was only 30 days and Intex will do nothing because it wasn't purchased directly through them. Up until the seam gave way it was an awesome boat
customer_reviews.author: Tami Harrison

customer_reviews.title: Want to be constantly repairing holes? Buy this raft
customer_reviews.text: Okay I'm seriously done with these, I've gone through 3 in the last three years. I've spent hundreds of dollars on accessories and re-registering them with the state so I can throw a measly trolling motor on it. The material on these constantly gets holes. I am extremely careful but there's always some way it gets holes. The repair process is tedious and you'd do better just buying a hard shell craft. I've wasted days and countless houra trying to repair and baby this POS raft. I'm done
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love this boat
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this boat!!! We've taken this bad boy out on the Puget Sound for Salmon fishing and it has been amazing! Handles waves like a champ, super comfy and pretty easy to launch.
customer_reviews.author: lostmystic

customer_reviews.title: Leaking valves
customer_reviews.text: Just recently purchased boat. I always make sure that there are no leaks before I take it out so right when I got it, I blow it up and sure enough I have a leak in all valves. I've purchased the intex' s 2 person kayak and it was perfect. Could just be a defected boat just super frustrating purchasing all the items to take this boat into the water and not be able to take it out. Will be contacting company and update my ratings based on arrival on new boat
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boat has no Hull Identification number (HIN)
customer_reviews.text: Upon receipt of product, i inspected, quality of boat ok. However, when i searched for the HIN (hull identification number), not on boat. HIN is needed to register boat, needed to use trolling motor. I called customer service and Intex automated response, we are too busy due to virus that we are not taking calls, use our email. I sent email requesting assistance. Company website promised response in 3-4 days. No response. Customer service is terrible., making this a bad product. I will not buy Intex products again. Because I waited for response from company in good faith the return date was exceeded.
customer_reviews.author: DakotaWild

customer_reviews.title: This Mariner 4 inflatable boat is Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I would of given this a 5 if I was sent the latest model.. otherwise great product... used it 6 times now on the ocean shores. I wanted to return it for the latest model but too heavy and don't want to deal with the hassle. Plus I think its same material just different color. Works very well and fits on my hatchback.. please note, (not latest model) updated the review.. it appears Amazon or who ever the seller is pick and choose when they want to ship the latest model now I am seeing the new model on YouTube. 3 stars now for who ever is in charge of what model they are selling..
customer_reviews.author: Mari N Ed

customer_reviews.title: Taking on water
customer_reviews.text: Got tons of holes and tears in just one trip down the river! Pushed off a couple of rocks, but should have withstood the bumps. Thanks we did not have the motor on this, a bit difficult to paddle also.
customer_reviews.author: Angels momma

customer_reviews.title: Great boat for camping
customer_reviews.text: Used previous buyers suggestion to inflate sides a little and Bottom slipped in effortlessly. One draw back is it takes two to blow up boat, one to hold the nozzle in the holes and one to pump. Looking for idea on more efficient way. Plan to use it in a week.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Rowe

customer_reviews.title: Birthday Present
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his birthday, due to covid-19 there is little we can do outside of the house. He has taken the boat down to the river roughly 3 times a week since he’s had it. The only piece of info you really need is that two adults in a boat is not good if you need to move out of a spot quickly. It’s not long enough, even though it’s a 2-person boat.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boat!
customer_reviews.text: I have used my boat numerous times over the course of the last 2 years. I've added a plywood floor, an electric motor and sun shade canopy. Because of the plywood floor I can use lawn chairs instead of the inflatable benches that come with although those benches work just fine too. This is just an awesome little boat. So far so good. Easy to pump up with the provided pump, so much so that I don't bother getting out my electric pump. After each outing, I hose it down, let it dry, roll it up and shove it into a compartment in my RV - No leaks, no issues at all. Love this little boat.
customer_reviews.author: Simon says

customer_reviews.title: Great boat for the price and is very heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: Great boat for the price and is very heavy duty. Like the idea that you can buy motor attachments and how easy to set up. Should tell you first the the hard floor included has to be installed first before inflating. Pretty happy with the quality of material and that free Amazon shipping. Made a great birthday present for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S.

customer_reviews.title: Leaking valve out of box, oars little short
customer_reviews.text: First test pump out of box, and one of the Boston valves didn't tighten, just kept on spinning non stop, and leaked air over night. The rest were good. The oars also feel a little too short, really slow, even if you are stroking fast and hard, waste too much energy. I live in California, and this boat got super hot at the lake, I don't know if it's the type of material, but hard to sit on, felt like burning your skin. Otherwise, a great boat, maybe a little pricey.
customer_reviews.author: Kustomer

customer_reviews.title: This boat is Irma-Proof!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the price is amazing. I bought this the week before Irma, just in case because we live in a flood zone. Our plan was to inflate in before we lost power, but that didn't happen. It only took me an hour to inflate using the hi-volume pump that came with it. The picture below speaks for itself, and with the help of the Intex Mariner-4, we were able to get water and supplies and check on the safety of our neighbors. Would buy again. Would buy at double the price. Was gonna sell it when we're done but it comes with a storage bag, so we're keeping it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect small sailboat dinghy
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. A dinghy for my small sailboat that I can stow down below when not in use. A cheap mattress inflator works better than the included pump and saves labor, but will not inflate it quite enough, so you need a few strokes with the pump. Love the rigid floor, very stable. This boat is sturdy and heavy, yet light enough that I can pick up the front end and leverage it into the cockpit. Just unscrew the valves then roll it up with floor in it, compact enough to fit through the companionway and stow it below. I got the motor mount and use a Minn Kota electric and 35 AH battery, works well.
customer_reviews.author: sonofasailor35

customer_reviews.title: Check packaging Thoroughly.
customer_reviews.text: Got it damaged. Like something pierced the box and punctured the boat itself. Didn’t have any oars in it either which was super strange, it’s like it was opened previously. Since the boat was folded up the puncture made at least 8 different holes. Sadly i forgot to message pictures to intex and get it replaced and we threw it out already. Hopefully I’m the only unlucky person that this has happen to.
customer_reviews.author: braeden jason strange

customer_reviews.title: You wonder why five right?
customer_reviews.text: Well I used this in the surf to row against as a seahawk 2, they came out with this one after I sold the other one and it can’t get any worse than the first I have moved and missed it a bunch so guess what I I bought and have now added the trolling motor setup and will be getting the sailing set from another company excellent product for the price oh and it was ten dollars less than the hawk rockon intex
customer_reviews.author: ArmageddonMarksman@yahoo

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to really like this product
customer_reviews.text: Boat arrived with a leak in it before it ever got in the water. Was difficult to patch initially. I wanted to really like this product, but the quality that I got was really bad. It's a nice concept.
customer_reviews.author: S. Sekar

customer_reviews.title: Leaking air right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This was my second mariner 4. First one started leaking air after first use. The second one had a pinhole near chamber 1 right out of the box. Even though there only one pinhole the whole boat lost air as I wait. The Boston valve open shouldn't be leaking air? My first one did not, but the second leaks air through the valve. This has ruined my good Sunday trip to the beach.
customer_reviews.author: S. Alam

customer_reviews.title: A Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I wanted something easy and inexpensive to go fishing on, so after some research I decided to purchase the Mariner 4. I unpacked the box and set up the boat in 15 minutes!!! A lot easier than I thought. Packed it up and took it to the lake for a test run, again 15 minutes to set up (that's with the included air pump) and in the water we went. I have a trolling motor on order, so we spent the day on the lake rowing around and fishing. We are both extremely happy with the boat and would recommend it without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice Inflatable
customer_reviews.text: This was the best price online when I purchased it. Very strong and the floor allows for a massive increase in stability compared to other things I tried out. The only downside inflation takes a while and you get a good exercise but pretty arduous. The other thing is its very heavy meaning deflated its very heavy so maneuverability is difficult. You need two people to carry it around
customer_reviews.author: Peter Kim

customer_reviews.title: Unpacked and a hole in the boat
customer_reviews.text: I went out to the lake to unpack and put the boat in the water. After setting the whole thing up I noticed a chamber was low. After I looked around it had a big melted hole in it. I'm pretty disappointed that this product shipped like that. The patch kit it comes with isnt a complete patch kit so make sure you get the stuff before going out. After all that I just folded it up and threw it back in the truck.
customer_reviews.author: mikeE

customer_reviews.title: Great Boat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this boat along with a small trolling motor and bracket. The boat is built well and seems capable. It would have earned 5 stars with one exception. The floor is ridged and very heavy. It takes extra time to set up but when set up it does the job very well. For the money I paid it is well worth it. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: deansplc

customer_reviews.title: Fits 4 Adults
customer_reviews.text: Four of us adults went down the Nantahala & over Nantahala falls with this. We did get 1 tear in the bottom but not enough to cause it to take on water. If you go white water rafting, you'll take on water regardless. We did pull over 3x (out of 4 miles) to dump the water out. You could bring a pail but it's just something else to lose or get caught in if you try to tie it to the raft. One of the raft guides even complemented the raft!
customer_reviews.author: Wicked Fit (Rebecca Cat)

customer_reviews.title: Horrible instructions and no customer service
customer_reviews.text: The instructions for use of this boat and for inflating it are horrible. The hand pump is not intuitive to use and also does not come with instructions. When you call the company's support, you get an endless loop of "Your call is important to us, blah blah." No one ever came on the line. it's not a cheap product; they might want to put more thought into the end user. Some of us are not born with the know-how as to how to use these products.
customer_reviews.author: Mizzhell

customer_reviews.title: Use the raft but first get a better oar
customer_reviews.text: The raft has worked well apart from the cheap oar which broke in the first hour of use. The two-part oar is connected by a thin, useless plastic joint that cannot handle a deep row. It left me stranded across the lake on a breezy day. Garbage accessory. Again, the raft has worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Only 90 Days warranty
customer_reviews.text: Poor warranty period, only 90 Days. Do not buy if you cannot use it right away to verify the integrity. Purchased the boat in April, was waiting for a chance to use it this summer. I discovered 2 of the Boston valves was leaking air on during my camping trip (definitely a manufacturing defect), but didn't get around calling and waiting on hold for their support line until August. I was expecting at least a 1 year warranty for these kind of items. Was told I was out of luck and had to replace it myself. For a seasonal item, I would expect longer than 90 days.
customer_reviews.author: TP

customer_reviews.title: Great boat at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: First of all, we ordered this at the last minute to take to Lake Tahoe specifically for the Truckee River, and we had it shipped to our hotel. It was due to arrival on Wednesday-which we nervous about as we planned on using it on Thursday - but it arrive ahead of time on Monday ! The boat is extremely sturdy and the floorboard makes the boat even more sturdy . We use a Milwaukee shop vacuum on reverse to inflate the boat - very fast indeed and also to deflate !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love this boat
customer_reviews.text: I use this boat for fishing and river cruising. This boat can be registered to your state as it has a Hull ID number on it and you can get the manufacturers certificate in Intex's web portal. I have a Minn Kota 30lb motor on it and it moves me at 5 MPH on nice sunny days. The oars are great and super light. I sometimes go with 2 of my buddies down the quebradilla river in puerto rico and row to go from point A to Point B with out the motor. Material is amazingly good and sturdy. My friends will be buying 1 for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: 3rd one i owned . cheap, will leak air and you wont be able to find the hole or seem ever
customer_reviews.text: 3rd one i owned . cheap, will leak air and you wont be able to find the hole or seem ever
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Leaked on the first try
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a fishing trip only to find that one of the chambers has a leak and I can not find it. Ruined my trip. Not sure what to do with it. Need to return it but can't because the return date has passed. DO NOT WAIST YOUR TIME ON THIS.
customer_reviews.author: Lit'lBro

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 4 boston valves leak on purchase
customer_reviews.text: Probably a great durable boat for its price, like the earlier and discontinued Intex Seahawk II (not the cheap Seahawk 2), but with 3 out of 4 boston valves leaking on initial inflation, useless.
customer_reviews.author: Ridahoan

customer_reviews.title: Enjoyable
customer_reviews.text: Have used it all day on about 10 occasions. Use a small electric pump and the four main chambers inflate in about 45 seconds each with the keel in about 25 seconds. Sturdy; flooring is nice feature. Motor mount and engine work well with the boat (3 hp). I got a small puncture hole in chamber #4 after third use, not sure how. Easily patched and is holding well. Looking for wheels for single person transport after inflated if anyone has recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: to many problems
customer_reviews.text: FIRST TIME I USED IT I SET IT UP IN A PARKING LOT, AFTER I AIRED IT UP I DRUG IT ABOUT TEN FEET TO THE WATER. SEVERAL SMALL PEBBLES WENT RIGHT THROUGH THE BOTTOM (TOWARDS THE FRONT) / THE NOZZLE TO FILL THE BOTTOM AREA IS HARD TO GET AIR INTO/ THE FLOOR HAS SLATS THAT ARE NOT ENCLOSED AND ARE HARD TO GET INTO THE AREA THAT THEY GO IN AND HAVE SHARP EXPOSED EDGES THAT SEEM LIKE SOONER OR LATER THEY COULD RUPTURE THE SIDES OR BOTTOM. ALL THE POSTS HAVE THE OWNERS BUILDING ANOTHER FLOOR ON TOP OF THAT ONE
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: What a great buy. This is the perfect watercraft for me, my wife, and our 5yo to enjoy a few hours on the water. It is sturdy, easy to pump, easy to transport in our SUV, and well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: George Hyek

customer_reviews.title: Boat leaked, poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Boat leaked and will not fit 3 people as advertised. Only 2 small seats. Might fit 3 children. Seller won't allow me to return boat even though it will sink from leak.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mariner 4 Review
customer_reviews.text: The raft is pretty sturdy and easy to set up with and without the electric pump. Can be easily deflated and put away without a hassle. The stowage bag does the job but can and will rip easily. I will caution that whomever will purchase this item should secure the pabble handles with duct tape because the glue thats current holding them together sucks. The raft can hold 4 skinny people with 2 small children comfortably with the seats. Normal people I would recommend no more than 3 without the seats. Can be used on a lake/pond, know your skill lvl and capability for a river or strong currents.
customer_reviews.author: Antoine Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The short and sweet.. We wanted a boat for fishing the local suburban lakes. Many of which do not allow gas motors. Didn't want the hassle of a boat and trailer, and didn't have the space. This solved everything. Very very well built. Easily modified (check out the YouTube video's.) Motor mount easily secured my electric motor (and small gas motor.) And fishing rods! A fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Portolese

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded expectations!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased Boat July 2018, I use it about four times a year. Well built and works great with my 30lbs thrust trolling motor and my 2hp Honda. Perfect for two kids and two adults. Easy to assemble but boat is quite heavy for one adult, inviting a helper is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: MAM

customer_reviews.title: Terrible customer service
customer_reviews.text: If you ever have to call the manufacturer, god have mercy on your soul. First they will put you on hold listening to the same message on repeat for 30 minutes. The first time I was then told the system was down and to call back the next day. I waited a couple of days to be sure it was working again and then this time after my 30 minutes or hold, was disconnected right after I gave them my phone number, which of course was not used to attempt to call me back. Three online inquiries submitted and two calls later, I do not think I will ever get the missing valve cap.
customer_reviews.author: Laura McCabe

customer_reviews.title: Decent product.
customer_reviews.text: It is very tight fit for me and my two kids. One of the Boston valves leaked from the get-go and I've had to order replacements. So that is a little annoying but we have really enjoyed using this inflatable. Have been fishing a number of times and look forward to when it warms up again over here to go fishing again.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Slow leak right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this boat. Two of the 5 Chambers did not hold air. I guess I'm going to have to break down and buy a real boat. Too bad, because I liked the design of this one.
customer_reviews.author: BubbaB

customer_reviews.title: Ahoy Mate!
customer_reviews.text: This boat came in a timely fashion. It inflated properly and stayed that way for 3 days on first use. Using an intex motor mount (purchased on sale at w****) and a craigslist 45lb minn kota it was tons of fun on a small lake. Can't wait to use it again. Somewhat hard to row because of oar positioning, takes getting situated just right. The included cushions are comfy. I don't think I would put 4 in the boat but we did have 3 (women) one day with one fishing and no one got hooked. It did not come with the see thru inflation gauge so I may request that from the seller once I figure out how.
customer_reviews.author: buyer

customer_reviews.title: I love this boat
customer_reviews.text: It is worth it for the money if you are looking into buying an inflatable boat. Excellent quality. Very durable 3-ply material, easy to inflate and deflate. You can mount any trolling motor or up to a 3HP outboard motor to it with the purchase of the Motor Mount Kit. *Recommended*
customer_reviews.author: Will Hamel

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boat!
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best boat I've ever purchased and I've owned bass boats, pontoon boats etc. Absolutely love this boat. After alot of modifications it's by far the best boat I've fished out of. I'd love a Mariner 6!
customer_reviews.author: RDAIV

customer_reviews.title: Great summer purchase
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast. I was pretty skepticle but we have used it down the river a bunch of times and it holds up with rocks and some low rapids. We have taken our two large dogs in it a few times and still holds up well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn West

customer_reviews.title: fantastic choice!
customer_reviews.text: I love my boat! This is a heavy duty and sturdy inflatable. Lots of room. Set up and take down is so easy. The floor is a huge plus! It allows one to actually step into and out of the boat. It is a bit heavy and takes two people to move it into the water. I have a foldable wagon that works well to transport it to the water. I would recommend this to anyone with limited space to store a boat but would like a "real" boat.
customer_reviews.author: chivohvoh

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this once for a 3 hour float down the river so far. The material seems decent. However I'm not super confident on the seams. The stitching looks iffy. I had to add some air about every hour but that may be because it was new and therefore stretching. We had 2 adults and 1 child and did just fine. 1 adult just sat on the back where the motor mount is. It was heavier than I expected. The seats were better than I expected, the stayed in place and stayed firm.
customer_reviews.author: JS jewelry

customer_reviews.title: Great raft, well built
customer_reviews.text: Great raft for the price. I was surprised at how quickly my 4 year old could inflate it using the floor pump. It’s been plenty big for us, easily handling 3 adults and 2 kids (4&2 yrs). The raft is solid and well built for the price. We’ve used it for float trips and have had no issues despite multiple encounters with snags, branches and rocks. Very pleased with our first season.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey G Koeck

customer_reviews.title: Check for leaks on seams!
customer_reviews.text: Great design but it developed a leak in the inflatable keel seam after two uses. Looks to be a manufacturing defect. That seam doesn’t overlap properly. Hopefully they’ll replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Ok, if you guys are planning to get a low budget boat this is it.... I have taken this boat to a lake once and to the ocean 3 times and I had to patch it 2 times already. The material appears thick, but it can be punctured pretty easily apparently. However, it's not too difficult to patch. The boat is huge for two adults, but I wouldn't recommend fitting more than 3 adults. By the way, Intex has no warranty on this boat so make sure you buy it from amazon so you can get the protection from them.
customer_reviews.author: Than Ho

customer_reviews.title: awesome little boat
customer_reviews.text: For the money, awesome little boat. I purchased a Newport 55 Pound Thrust 8 speed trolling motor which was more motor than the boat needed. With a battery I bought at Costco I managed to get a solid 4 hours of riding around each day. On a calm day I was able to get around farther than I expected. The floor mat makes all the difference in making this sturdy to stand/get around in while out and about. Also worth noting, I have a Pit Bull with some talons for nails which the boat managed to withstand! :)
customer_reviews.author: juxt(my)position

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on first trip
customer_reviews.text: Held up very well in a rough river. I am impressed so far. Paddles seem to be decent and lasted through two full days of rafting with my family and friends. Only takes about 10 minutes to pump up. I bought a large duffel for the pump and accs.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: great for the price, easy set up, works well with two people, 2 1/2 h p moves it well, 1st year now and satisfied with it, works out well and very pleased with it, added 2 piece plywood carpeted floor and a couple shortened milk crates with ply wood top and swivel boat seats on them . very comfy and can store anchor and other things in the crate. i cut them down to keep seat highth down. also made a dolly out of 1/2 in. galvenised pipe and a couple wheels and some pipe insulation on pipe for padding.works great under one end of boat and lift other end by handle and go.
customer_reviews.author: hodie1

customer_reviews.title: Great boat for a great price
customer_reviews.text: I love this boat/dingy. It's sturdy enough for me to stand in, and it putts around perfectly with my 30lb thrust minn kota trolling motor. It's also extremely durable, I've hit plenty on rocks and debris in the water and so far, no holes. Very well crafted piece of equipment. Highly recommend this for kids and/or adults that enjoy a weekend at the lake or on the river
customer_reviews.author: Tom and Kay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent inexpensive raft
customer_reviews.text: Great raft for two people or single. I was looking for a 10.5 ft raft that I could toss in my Tahoe and head for mountains. It inflates easily, floor installs quickly and the optional trolling motor mount works perfectly. I used with a 55 lb thrust MinnKota and have no regrets. The raft feels durable and well constructed for the price. Much easier to haul around than my 17' canoe. Its a bit tight in the bag but not a big deal, buy a big duffel when the supplied bag gives out.
customer_reviews.author: Ian E.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am not an expert on rafts, and this is our first one. We bought it for fishing at campgrounds and small lakes. It was a little smaller than we expected, three of us struggle to operate in it at one time. The quality seems really good. It's tough and really durable feeling. Inflate, deflate time is minimal and pretty easy. This is heavy at 80lbs and I struggle to lift it alone. One bad thing, in the first few times of using it, the inflatable keep didn't hold air more than 8 hours. I don't know what happened and I don't see a leak, but it doesn't seem like it should have leaked already.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Leaky valve.
customer_reviews.text: Everything works great, besides the leaky #2 valve. Seems very heavy duty. Good price. Picked up the trolling motor mount and a 30 lb thrust minn Kota motor. Would love if all the valves worked out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher West

customer_reviews.title: Leaks easily
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as an exchange because I originally purchased the 3 seater but needed more room for fishing gear. It now has two seams leaking (no actual holes). It's too late to return the boat, but I would think that it should hold up for longer than a month or two. If at all possible, I would like to exchange.
customer_reviews.author: Shelle

customer_reviews.title: Do It
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 4 months now. It is a sturdy pvc raft that I have modified into a registered and titled motor fishing boat. Great quality, stock slat floor is good for most applications. Oarlocks kinda suck and squeak when used. The intex motor mount is a perfect accessory should you choose the motorized route. All in all if you want to be cheap and still get a very worthy vessel this is a no brainer, the next step up costs $600. The total pictured set up cost me around $600. Enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: Connor c

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Material is sub par at best, 3 of the 4 main valves leak. Loading on a flat bed truck proved to much for material and punctured sidewall. Seems extremely week even after I patched the hole I honestly don’t trust this thing. For the price, absolutely not worth it! Take the money you would spend on this and throw it out your window while driving, you will feel better about it I promise. Not worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Zeb Cortese

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied buyer
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this boat is accurate. It takes about 45-50 seconds to inflate each section. We found if you inflate one side about 1/4 and the opposite side fully it is so easy to install the bottom. We took out on a lake and it was beautiful, so much fun. Very stable and enjoyable. Feels extremely sturdy and well constructed. You will love this craft. The oars are a little flimsy but are fine for lake paddling.
customer_reviews.author: Chrisrp

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: Love the raft. Very strong. Floor is too heavy and worthless. I'll build my own floor with birch. The oar locks are positioned in the middle of the raft which is a terrible spot. They should be towards the back like other rafts. First float in the river today with the dog and the wife. Very stable and easy to handle. We hit plenty of rocks, a couple strong bushes, and the dogs claws were all over the sides of the raft. Very impressed with the strength. I'll add longer oars and a better floor to perfect it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This boat is really bad product
customer_reviews.text: We’ve tried inflating different chambers, but only chamber 2 seems to hold air for a long time. Chambers 1,3, and 4 all leak air so I don’t think it’s just a valve problem. I’ve tried different things to fix it, but the raft is still leaking air and is not safe on the water. Can we please get a replacement and please send me the return label for this defective one? No good product to loos you money
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Looking forward to next summer!
customer_reviews.text: We are having a blast with this thing! Got in two trips last summer It is kind of heavy and awkward to carry for long distances but once you get it in the river all those worries are behind you. The boat itself is sturdy. The carrying bag is almost worthless Great size for 2 or 3, but I think 4 would be a little tight unless two of them are kids
customer_reviews.author: In Cog Nito

customer_reviews.title: Intex Mariner 4, 4-Person Boat Set Aluminum Oars High Output Air Pump
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Intex M 4 to keep in our camper for lake trips and such. It's come in handy with the motor mount purchased seperately and a 60lb thrust trolling motor we obtained. so far, it's only been my wife and I in the boat but it's been a pleasure. very stable too if that is one of your concerns.
customer_reviews.author: Larry V. Fulmer Jr.

customer_reviews.title: and you're good to go
customer_reviews.text: This will be my 2nd summer using this product on the Chattahoochee River and I must say this thing is a beast. I can put myself, my two German Shepherds, and gal pal in this thing with no problems. Also the dog's paws won't puncture the sides. Not only has it held up to rocks/rapids, but you can slap on a trolling motor, add a sturdier floor, and you're good to go! Plus it folds up in my apartment storage unit when needed. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Philip C.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you didn’t get a dud
customer_reviews.text: Make sure to test this boat soon after you get it. It was 4 months after I bought it to find out it had a slow leak when weight was applied once in the water. Too late to return/replace, buying a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Berova

customer_reviews.title: 100% recommend this boat
customer_reviews.text: 100% recommend this boat. I added a solid wood floor and modified the motor mount some and the boat is great now. I have a 3.5HP Mercury outbaord on it and it'll go about 10MPH. Very well constructed and easy to inflate and get into the water. One note: Get a seperate duffle bag for the roll up floor, it's too heavy to put the boat and the floor in the included travel bag.
customer_reviews.author: Matt K

customer_reviews.title: Great boat!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great boat but REALLY heavy, so be prepared...we weren't! My husband and I got this boat so we could bring our 80 lb dog along with us on a river float. The bottom has heavy duty plastic slats that insert into a second layer that you place at the bottom of the boat. The bottom section weighs as much as the boat itself. It's a two person lift for sure. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific and very multi functional inflatable. I purchased a sailing kit from Sailboats to Go and I'm having an absolute blast with it on all of our Central Oregon lakes. Very stable and reliable. Do yourself a favor and get the Intex DC inflator so you can start playing on the water more quickly. This is a very well made boat and a great value for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon scooter

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for! I've taken it out 6 times so far on small lakes and with no issues. Seems to be pretty durable. I'd say it can only comfortably seat two people. No more than three especially if you have bags, equipment, life vests, cooler, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Jermaine Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for cruising/floating
customer_reviews.text: Very happy! I used a 12v pump to inflate at the boar dock and was very easy. I bought the motor mount for an electric trolling motor I already had. Solid sturdy floor was a big plus. Just need to figure out some shade
customer_reviews.author: barbs

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: The boat is good, but Amazon will not support you. I can not register the boat in AZ, which is required if you install a motor. The reason I cannot register this boat is Amazon refuses to sign a Bill of Sale. a simple document, it has only 3 fields on it. Name of Seller (Amazon), Name of Buyer (Me) and description of boat including the HIN. So my advise is do not purchase anything aquatic from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: tt

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: A perfect inflatable for flat water! Semi-rigid floor is great for stability. Included manual pump works reasonably. 30 pumps per section. Boston air valves are nice. ONLY negative consideration is weight. Two people needed to haul it around. Flex floor is pretty heavy by itself. This is a great value for inflatable under 1000 pound capacity!! 2 person fishing boat. Oar locks are dead center, one person rows, one fishes. Two 250+ guys no problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: Idaho Bob

customer_reviews.title: ... out for hours and all the tubes were just fine the base is heavy and sturdy and i like ...
customer_reviews.text: My first outing one of the tubes deflated but when i got back to shore i didn't attach the Boston valve on right so my second outing i was out for hours and all the tubes were just fine the base is heavy and sturdy and i like the fact the cushions are removable and overall the raft is very sturdy compared to what i had in the past
customer_reviews.author: Kennergee

customer_reviews.title: Same as older model with a couple minor changes.
customer_reviews.text: Previously bought 2 others of the older model and had no problems other than normal wear. Purchased new model and the seams are leaking somewhere. Cant find it so I have to return it. Few changes in the boat handle and paddles. Like the new air cap modification. Other than that and the color scheme its same boat as older model. Seems like it cost a little more.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Titling in Missouri
customer_reviews.text: I have not had a chance to get out on the water but am passing along a few observations. Missouri did not accept the manufacturer's certificate of origin and receipt as sufficient proof. I had to get an inspection by the highway patrol and a form 798. I bought two duffel bags to carry it.  Much easier to manage as two loads with the handles on a quality duffel.
customer_reviews.author: James A. Connolly

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It works but it is heavy to carry around and the bottom is thin, the lakes around me have trees in them.
customer_reviews.author: JOHN

customer_reviews.title: Nope, don’t like it PITA
customer_reviews.text: I would return this if I could because the floor of the boat is a nightmare to move, clean, drain and store. The quality of the rubber is just fine but it’s very heavy and bulky, it doesn’t fold down easily and the slats fall out when removed from the floor. Also the caps of the valves are easily lost.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Flowers

customer_reviews.title: Valve failure after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Excited to get this but the main Boston valve failed a bit after 2 months rendering this useless. Now attempting to get a replacement but this should not have failed regardless. Trying to get through to Intex is a joke, does anyone answer their phones at this company? I do not recommend this piece of garbage to anyone, it’s not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Kaye

customer_reviews.title: Love this boat!
customer_reviews.text: Truly amazing inflatable boat. We put 2 adults and 2 kids (9 and 11) in it..and there was still room! We had a fantastic time. The first had a slow leak somewhere..Amazin replaced it. No issues with it. Taken on lake twice...love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Oak doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Oaks too weak, not enough for the boat, if you want to use the boat you need to buy the motor, battery, cables
customer_reviews.author: Katalina

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Used twice for a total of about 2 hours before developing 2 leaks. One leak on bottom was repairable, the other in a welded seam unrepairable. Very, very disappointed in the Intex product! Tried contacting Intex Customer Service which was next to impossible! Finally gave up..
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real boat!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first boat and it surprised me on how good it is! It can fit easy 4 people in with no gear, I added a Honda 2.3 hp 4 stroke motor and it is great set up, I am still on the break in of the motor so in half throttle it is been around 5 to 6 Mph Pretty easy to set up and I think the floor is good just as it is, pretty stable. Sure recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Rodolfo Mattos

customer_reviews.title: Great Boat
customer_reviews.text: I've take out on the lake a few times. I added a pvc frame with 12 oak planks for elevated seats. Its pretty tough, Easy to inflate and super fun. It's honestly very easy to row and maneuvers well. I did add a trolling motor for ease. The included flooring is sturdy enough for me but, I weight 170 pounds. So far i am more than satisfied with this boat
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas McNair

customer_reviews.title: Superb value.  No comparison for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this boat for a couple months with a 2.5 hp outboard. It is an outstanding value. Very durable, holds air very well. Very comfortably fits me and two kids. You could fit more than 2 adults but it would begin to compromise comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Best Boat!!
customer_reviews.text: Best boat EVER! We raft all the time and we used this boat all summer! Easy to steer. Thick strong sides. Love the hard bottom! Originally bought it to take my pit bull on it. Figured it would be strong enough so it wouldn’t pop but my friends loved it so much they kept filling up the boat! Next year we are taking the dog! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Best 4-Person Inflatable Boat out there!
customer_reviews.text: This is a top quality boat! The whole family loves it and it's great for fishing. We bought the Motor Mount Kit with it and attached an electric motor so getting around is a breeze. No air leaks and everything seems to be built to last. Shipping was quick and assembly and disassembly is a snap!
customer_reviews.author: S. Bowen

customer_reviews.title: Durable raft for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Mariner 4 raft. They are very durable and sturdy, though after a couple seasons rafting down the river they get worn out and develop unrepairable leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to inflate and deflate. Goes fast by hand because of the multiple chambers. We bought an electric pump too. I am glad I chose one with a floor. It would be too unstable. You could also make a 3-piece plywood floor if you choose the cheaper version of this boat.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany L

customer_reviews.title: Prone to punctures! Too fragile!
customer_reviews.text: Very fragile boat for the price. Too easy to puncture. We were careful with it and still managed to get three punctures in it from unknown causes. It's also difficult to patch as it does not come with a complete patch kit.
customer_reviews.author: Tim T.

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Boat
customer_reviews.text: The boat is very well made. So far only two people at a time have ridden in it one weighed 310lbs and the other 212lbs we sat one at each end. There is a place designed specifically for the motor mount to attach. Which is sold seporately but fits perfectly. The seat cushions sit you a little low we sat on ice chests. The paddles will row you straight to nowhere, they are completely worthless. And you better have a good air pump electric or two way hand pump as there are quite a few chambers to fill.
customer_reviews.author: Logan A.

product_meta.title: Intex Mariner Inflatable Boat Set Series
feature_bullets: The strong molecular structure of this plastic makes it highly resistant to damage from abrasion, impact and sunlight.
Four Boston valves on main hull chamber for quick-fills and fast-deflations.
The keel is inflatable; this results in improved control and handling.
A durable rock guard lines the circumference of the hull above which an all-around nylon grab line circles the upper hull.
Maximum weight capacity- 1100 pounds. Inflated Dimensions: 129" x 57" x 19" (328 x 145 x 48cm).
The strong molecular structure of this plastic makes it highly resistant to damage from abrasion, impact and sunlight.
Four Boston valves on main hull chamber for quick-fills and fast-deflations.
The keel is inflatable; this results in improved control and handling.
A durable rock guard lines the circumference of the hull above which an all-around nylon grab line circles the upper hull.
Weight Capacity: 880 Lbs. (400 kg) - Inflated Dimensions: 129" x 57" x 19" (328 x 145 x 48cm).

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
